VIPSPage.PageTitle: Official Homepage of IEEE International Conference on Data Mining 2010, December 14-17, 2010, Sydney, Australia ::.. Call for Case Studies

LayoutNode.Content: Following the successes of the 10 Challenging Problems in Data Mining Research at ICDM’05 and the Top 10 Algorithms in Data Mining at ICDM '06 and as part of the 10 year celebration of IEEE’s International Conference on Data Mining series (ICDM), the Top-10 Data Mining Case Studies panel at ICDM’10 will present the top 10 data mining case studies submissions by ten of the top data miners in the field.
LayoutNode.SRC: Following the successes of the 10 Challenging Problems in Data Mining Research at ICDM’05 and the Top 10 Algorithms in Data Mining at ICDM '06 and as part of the 10 year celebration of IEEE’s International Conference on Data Mining series (ICDM), the Top-10 Data Mining Case Studies panel at ICDM’10 will present the top 10 data mining case studies submissions by ten of the top data miners in the field.

LayoutNode.Content: The panel's objective is to highlight data mining implementations that have made a significant impact in order to help the community to set a baseline for the success criteria of a successful contemporary data mining application that practitioners can use to improve their deployments, and for data mining researchers to push the state of the art. The moderated panel will take place on December 17th at the 10th IEEE International Conference on Data Mining (ICDM’10).
LayoutNode.SRC: The panel's objective is to highlight data mining implementations that have made a significant impact in order to help the community to set a baseline for the success criteria of a successful contemporary data mining application that practitioners can use to improve their deployments, and for data mining researchers to push the state of the art. The moderated panel will take place on December 17th at the 10th IEEE International Conference on Data Mining (ICDM’10).

LayoutNode.Content: Most operational industrial and scientific systems that involve data mining to some extent are likely to be acceptable. Systems that are responsible for mission critical systems, medical applications, cash flow, or applications that significantly benefit humanity will be particularly good candidates. Other known topic areas of successful data mining applications include:
LayoutNode.SRC: Most operational industrial and scientific systems that involve data mining to some extent are likely to be acceptable. Systems that are responsible for mission critical systems, medical applications, cash flow, or applications that significantly benefit humanity will be particularly good candidates. Other known topic areas of successful data mining applications include:
• Survival analysis for medical procedures
• Correlates of genes with disease

LayoutNode.Content: Data visualization in mission-critical user interfaces
LayoutNode.SRC: • Data visualization in mission-critical user interfaces

LayoutNode.Content: Please complete the data mining case study questionnaire found (here) and submit it to the panel submission site found (here) by the submission deadline date.
LayoutNode.SRC: Please complete the data mining case study questionnaire found (here) and submit it to the panel submission site found (here) by the submission deadline date.

LayoutNode.Content: You may contact the co-chairs at: icdm10panel@predictionworks.com This e-mail address is being protected from spambots. You need JavaScript enabled to view it .
LayoutNode.SRC: You may contact the co-chairs at: icdm10panel@predictionworks.com This e-mail address is being protected from spambots. You need JavaScript enabled to view it .
Submissions site open
Submissions site closed
Notification of selection
Panel held

LayoutNode.Content: Advertisement: Data Mining Case Studies is not a sales venue. References to commercial products will be carefully scrutinized by our selection committee for applicability. Where possible the underlying techniques should be described.
LayoutNode.SRC: • Advertisement: Data Mining Case Studies is not a sales venue. References to commercial products will be carefully scrutinized by our selection committee for applicability. Where possible the underlying techniques should be described.

LayoutNode.Content: Verifiability: Valid contact information for the company that deployed the data mining system must be supplied to the Program Committee. The Program Committee should be afforded the right to contact individuals that were the beneficiaries of the data mining system and ask them questions about the implementation
LayoutNode.SRC: • Verifiability: Valid contact information for the company that deployed the data mining system must be supplied to the Program Committee. The Program Committee should be afforded the right to contact individuals that were the beneficiaries of the data mining system and ask them questions about the implementation

LayoutNode.Content: Confidentiality: The reviewing process will be confidential.
LayoutNode.SRC: • Confidentiality: The reviewing process will be confidential.
